Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Nurse to Initiate Medication phase of this plan
Medications
LORazepam sublingual PRN range dose
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, sublingual, pre-procedure, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
lidocaine 1% inj
10 mL, intradermal, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
lidocaine 1% inj
20 mL, fetal administration, once, drug form: inj
potassium chloride
40 mmol, fetal intracardiac, once, drug form: inj
Dosing guidance for rocuronium: 1 mg/kg  dosing based on estimated fetal weight
rocuronium
mg, fetal IM, once, drug form: inj

Patient Care
For viable pregnancies, select External Fetal Heart Monitor for post procedure NST on TACC or other inpatient unit
External Fetal Heart Monitor
once, Complete NST post invasive prenatal procedure on TACC or upon return to inpatient unit
Diagnostic Tests
Select required follow-up US to be performed in the days/weeks following the procedure but NOT ON THE SAME DAY. If US is required the day of the procedure, select orders from the pre-procedure phase
